documentation.text:
@title ArbitrableProxy
 A general purpose arbitrable contract. Supports non-binary rulings.

@title Arbitrator
 Arbitrator abstract contract  compliant with ERC-792.
 When developing arbitrator contracts we need to:
 - Define the functions for dispute creation (createDispute) and appeal (appeal). Don't forget to store the arbitrated contract and the disputeID (which should be unique, may nbDisputes).
 - Define the functions for cost display (arbitrationCost and appealCost).
 - Allow giving rulings. For this a function must call arbitrable.rule(disputeID, ruling).

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Dispute already created for this report"

arguments.value: Dispute already created for this report

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Dispute already created for this report"

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes memory,string memory,uint256) payable external returns (uint256)
function (bytes memory,string memory,uint256) payable external returns (uint256)

Ruling(address,uint256,uint256).details: To be raised when a ruling is given.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.

createDispute(bytes,string,uint256).details: TRUSTED. Calls createDispute function of the specified arbitrator to create a dispute.      Note that we don’t need to check that msg.value is enough to pay arbitration fees as it’s the responsibility of the arbitrator contract.

params._arbitratorExtraData: Extra data for the arbitrator of prospective dispute.
params._metaevidenceURI: Link to metaevidence of prospective dispute.

returns.disputeID: Dispute id (on arbitrator side) of the dispute created.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: Give a ruling for a dispute. Must be called by the arbitrator. The purpose of this function is to ensure that the address calling it has the right to rule on the contract.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: Ruling given by the arbitrator. Note that 0 is reserved for "Not able/wanting to make a decision".

devdoc.title: ArbitrableProxy A general purpose arbitrable contract. Supports non-binary rulings.

devdoc.title: IArbitrable Arbitrable interface compliant with ERC-792. When developing arbitrable contracts, we need to: - Define the action taken when a ruling is received by the contract. - Allow dispute creation. For this a function must call arbitrator.createDispute{value: _fee}(_choices,_extraData);

AppealDecision(uint256,address).details: To be emitted when the current ruling is appealed.

params._arbitrable: The contract which created the dispute.

AppealPossible(uint256,address).details: To be emitted when a dispute can be appealed.

params._arbitrable: The contract which created the dispute.

DisputeCreation(uint256,address).details: To be emitted when a dispute is created.

params._arbitrable: The contract which created the dispute.

appeal(uint256,bytes).details: Appeal a ruling. Note that it has to be called before the arbitrator contract calls rule.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to be appealed.
params._extraData: Can be used to give extra info on the appeal.

appealCost(uint256,bytes).details: Compute the cost of appeal. It is recommended not to increase it often, as it can be higly time and gas consuming for the arbitrated contracts to cope with fee augmentation.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to be appealed.
params._extraData: Can be used to give additional info on the dispute to be created.

appealPeriod(uint256).details: Compute the start and end of the dispute's current or next appeal period, if possible. If not known or appeal is impossible: should return (0, 0).

arbitrationCost(bytes).details: Compute the cost of arbitration. It is recommended not to increase it often, as it can be highly time and gas consuming for the arbitrated contracts to cope with fee augmentation.

params._extraData: Can be used to give additional info on the dispute to be created.

createDispute(uint256,bytes).details: Create a dispute. Must be called by the arbitrable contract. Must be paid at least arbitrationCost(_extraData).

params._choices: Amount of choices the arbitrator can make in this dispute.
params._extraData: Can be used to give additional info on the dispute to be created.

currentRuling(uint256).details: Return the current ruling of a dispute. This is useful for parties to know if they should appeal.

returns.ruling: The ruling which has been given or the one which will be given if there is no appeal.

disputeStatus(uint256).details: Return the status of a dispute.

params._disputeID: ID of the dispute to rule.

devdoc.title: Arbitrator Arbitrator abstract contract  compliant with ERC-792. Don't forget to store the arbitrated contract and the disputeID (which should be unique, may nbDisputes). - Define the functions for cost display (arbitrationCost and appealCost). - Allow giving rulings. For this a function must call arbitrable.rule(disputeID, ruling).
